ratings.comment: As people have said, he's old school. If you can't deal with that, his classes may be miserable for you. If that doesn't bother you, he will be one of the most knowledgeable, enthusiastic men you'll ever learn from. His expertise and passion for teach about IR and China are infectious. The essays are handwritten and graded tough but fair.

Professor Friedman is an amazing man. He's probably the most knowledgeable professor I've had the pleasure of being taught by at UW. His lecture style was old-fashioned (no laptops, no powerpoint slides), but it really makes you reminisce about having to actively listen to professors. Friedman is a genius, and had some good stories to tell too!

Professor Friedman is old school. He doesn't use powerpoint just an a projector that has a paper with keywords on it. He can be funny and very personable but he goes on tangents a lot and his lectures can be hard to follow. He's a forgiving grader if you do worse on the first exam then the others he'll drop it. Prepare to do tons of reading.

Professor Friedman is a highly respected intellectual on Chinese foreign policy and has real world experience in dealing with the CCP. Lectures aren't "fun" but they are incredibly factual. Be prepared to take your own notes however, but do not expect much help from him. If you're interested in foreign policy, take this class.

Friedman is phenomenal. Well-respected in his field, has experience in the public sector, and a true expert in Chinese Foreign Policy. I would absolutely recommend this class to anybody interested in foreign policy, and I would take it again if I could.

Friedman is not for everyone. He teaches in a very old school way, without powerpoint and few prepared notes. hes an expert and his lectures are fascinating, but you want to probably invest in a voice recorder or know how to take his lecture word for word.

Professor Friedman is an authority on China. He has been teaching for many years but is still passionate about the subject. His method is incredibly old-fashioned (he projects keywords written with pencil on the screen) and messy, but lectures are rewarding. Exams are open book, essay questions are known before. Easy & interesting class.

Great professor, probably one of my favorite I've had. He had a position in the US federal government, so he also has some insight into that. He is greatly knowledgable about China and I've learned quite a bit. Not an easy class, but you learn China inside and out.

I nearly killed myself trying to do my best only to realize everyone was getting the same grades I was. Some people might like that he gives the same grades; I hated it. Expectations weren't clear and he tended to ramble on and lose everyone without realizing it.

Lectures are dry and long, but Prof. Friedman knows his material well. Essays are pretty easy if you've done the readings, short answer exams are do-able if you've gone to class and managed to stay awake. Just make sure to agree with everything he says in essays or he'll give you a lower grade..

Take his class.  His lectures can get long and confusing, but he's generally interesting and hilarious.  I recommend taking his honors section even if you aren't an honors student.  Having discussion section with just him was valuable and I have a hunch that it helped me get an A.

Prof Friedman is FANTASTIC! No, he doesn't make pretty powerpoint slides and you cannot sleep through his class and expect to do well, but if you read, write the papers (they're not so bad) and put in the effort you will certainly get an A and learn a ton. The material is very interesting and Prof. is engaging and hilarious. My fav class. Take him!
Lectures tend to be scattered and hard to follow and lots of reading required. A fair grader on exams, though.

Friedman is extremely knowledgeable. Lecture is boring at times, but I feel like I learned a lot of important and useful information given China's rise to power. Extremely fair (maybe even easy) grader. 3 ABs is an A in the class. Exams are essay and short answer). Exams are easy, because you type the essays ahead of time.

Ace on the subject of china. Not an ace on making chinese politics understandable for undergrads. Lectures can be either extremely boring or intriguing, depending on the day and the student. Exams are pretty easy--you can combine with a partner on essays and use notes on IDs. Readings are optional but useful if youwant to learn the material well.

Negative comments for this professor seem to come from his Poli Sci 106 class. He is a very brilliant teacher, and is incredibly knowledgeable and open to share it with students. Class was heavy in reading, but straightforward with no hidden tricks. Do not take this professor if you want easy credits. If you take his class you will learn a ton.
Super intelligent, definitely a China expert. Lectures are dense and hard to follow. Tons of reading, but I learned a lot in this class. An A is not guarenteed, you have to work/read.

Friedman is incredibly knowledgeable and passionate about the subject.  Tests are straightforward and Friedman is beyond accessible.  Go to lecture, put in the work, and you will both learn a ton and receive a good grade.

He is one of the best professors I have had since coming to Madison...This is coming from someone with no poly sci background. Yes, he can be a bit vague at times and yes a little disorganized. However, his grading is very forgiving(drops first midterm if lower and Ab-Ab-Ab becomes an A). also extremely knowledgeable and willing to answer ques

I don't know why people are unhappy with Friedman. He doesn't get too nitty gritty in the reading. The grading's fair. If you mess up your exams, he'll drop it. And I think he's one of the best lecturers on campus. If you don't like writing and lectures on political theory, don't take advanced political science courses.
I just realized that most of his negative comments are for 106.  I can see how he would be intimidating in an intro class, but he was awesome for politics of the world economy.

This is the clas that you will appreciate once the semester is over. Friedman is willing to accomadate you in the best way that will allow you to succeed in his classes. Very interesting lecture material and always welcomes student feedback.  Final is three take home essays or two take home essays and 5 short answers...which are doable!

I am really surprised about all these negative ratings.  If you COME to class, DO the readings, PARTICIPATE in section, and WORK on your papers, you don't have to be any kind of genious to get a good grade.  This is supposed to be a challenging school, guys.

Very intelligent man, has been teaching the class for decades.  However, rambles a lot and syllabus is devoid of useful information.  Expects students to teach a large part of the class, but constantly interrupts and derails their presentations.  Impossible to know what is expected--paper topics are insanely vague, and reading is sporatic and long.
lots of writing
Never have to come to class, and he lets you do partner take home exams.  Very easy class.

I hated this class.  It's boring, he's not a good lecturer.  He expects his students to be well versed in economics, but this is a political science class!  He's very smart, but doesn't know how to get ideas across to people who aren't at his level.  I would not recommend him unless you know the subject well already.

Are you ready for a boring power-lecture? Are you ready for even more boring texts? Are you ready for a pretentious, snobby academic to drive you to thoughts of committing suicide rather than listening to him say one more word?  If you are, you are ready for Friedman's class on democratization!

Knows his stuff but not how to convey it to others. I wouldn't mind talking politics with him over a cup of coffee, but to listen to him lecture- yuk. Hard to get to talk to him and when you do he is condescending.

IMPOSSIBLE PROFESSOR! I went in to ask him for help on how to structure my papers and we ended up talking about how he got really bad grades his freshman year of college? Completely unhelpful. Plus, he gives off a super rude vibe like undergrad students not majoring in Chinese politics are the scum of the earth
The guy doesn't stick to one topic. He goes between five things on and off for an entire power lecture and you never know when he's switching subjects or switching back.
He's a horrible lecturer and goes off topic alot! But overall, kinda easy class if you stay awake during his lectures. But I recommend another teacher if you want to get more out of this course.
If you attend lecture and pay attention you will do fine...he was very knowledge on his material and i enjoyed listening to his lectures.
Do not take this class unless you absolutely have to...it's not worth the trouble trust me.
Brilliant mind. very engaging
Ugh. Tangents. He goes off on tangents. It's so hard to follow him when he does that. I can't stress it enough---- very knowledgeable on China though. haha

This is the only polisci class which has ever made me think enough to be frightened about my grade. I went into the class thinking I knew a thing or two about Chinese politics, but goddamn was I wrong. I did, however, come out being able to kick anyone's (but his) ass in the subject. He is awesome.
interesting readings and papers for exams, but lectures are almost unbearable

Even though he is a bit all over the place, I really liked him.  Instead of a crappy textbook we read interesting books, and he let lecture out early just about every day.  He's more than fair when it comes to grading, and he really knows his stuff - just a bit scatter-brained.  I would definitely take one of his courses again.

Lectures rambled and were not well organized (though full of random interesting information). He really wants to give you a good grade (and even dropped people's 1st grd if it was lower than their 2nd) & welcomed questions. Interesting class but not structured very well.
very knowledgeable
His lectures ramble (asides full of somewhat relevant, but interesting info), and the notes he writes are tricky to understand, but you will learn a lot.
He really knows his stuff, but deciphering his code is tough.  Its hard to figure out what he is asking for, might be good for an advanced class but not worth it for 106
No Comments
he is challenging but so intelligent and if you get to know him, a truly inspiring and wonderful, quirky man.  talk to him about China...he knows more than most!

This guy is not a good professor. His lecture notes are not legible nor are they organized whatsoever. He lied about the format of the final exam and is unsympathetic to any of his students. And this is coming from some one who got an A in his class.
Excellent Professor.  You'll actually learn something, pay attention and take notes, extremely knowledgeable

The imperative part of Friedman's class was finding a spot where he couldn't see us sleeping, doing crossword puzzles or eating breakfast. His essay questions took five times as long to figure out what they were asking as they did to write. Save yourself while you can and take 106 from someone else!
Terrible voice.  Always made us use his terrible text and bragged about it constantly.

I have to say that I learned a lot about how to write a good poli sci paper in this class and I was proud of myself for my hard work but he is the most unclear, hard to follow, unhelpful b*tchy little man. I fell asleep in every lecture!!

If this guy gave a clear and organized lecture, it would be a miracle.  I emailed him for help on something, and his response was extremely rude and did not answer the question.  If you can take this class with another professor, DO IT!

Friedman is one of the greatest college professors and int'l authorities in the academic realm on Chinese politics. For all who do not understand Ed Friedman, understand this: do your reading, listen to the lectures, and learn to write a paper.
Avoid this class at all costs!

Difficult prof, but welcome to UW...if you want to learn, this shouldn't be easy, stop whining.  Outlines describe what the lecture will cover.  Readings are crucial to understanding many views on the topics.  Helpful if you make an effort to talk to him.
Friedman sucks.  On Thursday's lecture he said "Euro****" instead of "Europeans" and acted like nothing happened.
tons of reading, horribly boring, hard to follow lectures...AVOID THIS ONE AT ALL COSTS
No overheads, powerpoints - just straight lecture.  Syllabus, grading scale is vague. Very hard, specific tests - if you didn't do the readings, forget about it.
No Comments
difficult
No Comments

he is very biased, just rambles on, and grades in that class are very hard. I suggest NOT to take his class if you dont have to. It's not worth all the pain, and there is SO much reading to do in that class! It's insane!

VERY anal old man!!! Students are given no information on the grading strucutre and when I asked the TA if she knew, she said the prof doesn't tell them either! She did say though, that they are able to raise and lower final grades! sounds fair huh?
